intro: Thyrasperma helianthoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sunflower, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in dry, open habitats. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow composite flowers with ray florets. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Thyrasperma helianthoides is adapted to arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant traits such as deep root systems and reduced leaf surface area.
